Description: Translucent white and yellow-brown calcite jar with banding cut horizontally; flattish base, two solid oval lug handles above splayed lappets and flat lip; very finely polished, lip chipped; hole worn in side of body; erased Egyptian cartouche on the side.
Bibliographic references: Searight, Reade & Finkel 2008a / Assyrian Stone Vessels and related material in the British Museum (270, p.33, fig.16)
Leichty E 1986a / Catalogue of the Babylonian Tablets in the British Museum: Volume VI: Tablets from Sippar, I (p.299)
Walker CBF & Collon 1980a / Hormuzd Rassam's excavations for the British Museum at Sippar in 1881-1882 (p.99, pl.27)
Guide 1922 / Guide to the Babylonian and Assyrian Antiquities in the British Museum (p.214)
Condition: Fair / poor; lip chipped; hole worn in side of body.
